pages.text: Konnichiwa! That means Hello in Japanese. My name is Alexandria and welcome to my world.
pages.title: Introduction

pages.text: Today we are traveling to Japan.
pages.title: Arrival

pages.text: Did you know that Japan is made up of over 6,800 islands? The four main islands are Honshu, Hokkaido, Kyushu, and Shikoku.
pages.title: Plane Window View

pages.text: I am visiting my friend Sakura. She is from Tokyo, Japan.
pages.title: Meeting Friend

pages.text: "Konnichiwa Alexandria! We have much to show you," says Sakura. "Tonight, we will have a special meal."
pages.title: With Family

pages.text: In the tatami room, we eat many traditional foods like onigiri rice balls, miso soup, tempura vegetables, and sweet mochi.
pages.title: Traditional Meal

pages.text: "We say 'Itadakimasu' before eating to thank the food," says Sakura. "In Japan, we show respect for everything that gives us life."
pages.title: Cultural Story

pages.text: Sakura's dad takes us to Akihabara, the anime and electronics district! The bright lights and colorful buildings are amazing. I see my favorite anime characters everywhere!
pages.title: Akihabara Adventure

pages.text: Deep in Nara Park, we feed friendly deer with special crackers. The deer bow to us before taking the treats!
pages.title: Nature Interaction

pages.text: Today, we are at Fushimi Inari Shrine. "These thousands of red torii gates lead up the mountain," says Sakura. "People from all over the world come to walk through them."
pages.title: Famous Landmark

pages.text: Sakura teaches me how to fold origami cranes. "In Japan, we believe that folding one thousand cranes brings good luck and peace," she explains as I carefully make each fold.
pages.title: Cultural Participation

pages.text: Even though we live in different places, it is good that we enjoy the same things.
pages.title: Shared Experience

pages.text: I thank Sakura for showing me around Japan. Sakura says, "Sayonara means goodbye." I say, "Sayonara my friend!"
pages.title: Goodbye
